concern:
I went back to college part-time at night in 2019. Because of my previous enrolment in college 8 years prior, I was exempt from most of the modules. I done 9 modules over the course of 5 semesters. We graduated from that course in 2021 and immediately went into another one which I'm due to graduate having had to do every module in May.

I didn't receive my parchment in November of 2021 like everybody else in my class. Months went by and I still didn't receive it, so I emailed my department in February of 2022. I got an email back saying it would take a bit of paperwork as they had to combine the results from when I was there in the early 2010s and the part-time course I done. I waited a few months and e-mailed again in May of 2022 and was told leave it with them. Frustrating, but I was still in no rush as I still had a year left in my new course. 

It's now nearly a year and a half since I should've received that parchment and I'm due to graduate the other course in two months or so. I've two emails written out, one angry demanding one to my department, and one nice one to the awards office basically burying my department. Which one should I send?

I've mad anxiety, that's why I haven't sent any.

dialogue_total.statement: Welcome! I'm here to listen and offer support. Is there anything on your mind that you'd like to share?
I'm feeling anxious about an unresolved issue from my past college experiences. I'd like to discuss how this is impacting my daily life and emotions.

It sounds like this unresolved issue is causing you a lot of distress and affecting your daily life. I can understand how that could be difficult to deal with. Would you feel comfortable sharing more about the issue?
I'm not sure if I'm comfortable sharing more details right now because my anxiety is making it hard to open up. It's been weighing on me emotionally as I deal with this ongoing uncertainty.

It's completely understandable to feel hesitant about sharing more details, especially when anxiety is involved. I want to assure you that this is a safe space for you to express yourself, and there's no pressure to share anything you're not comfortable with. Perhaps we can start by discussing some general coping strategies for anxiety, and see if that helps you feel more at ease?

I appreciate the suggestion to discuss coping strategies, as my anxiety has been making it tough to manage the emotional weight of this ongoing uncertainty. I'm open to trying that, hoping it might help me feel more grounded in my daily life.

It's great to hear that you're open to discussing coping strategies. Let's start with a simple technique called deep breathing. Have you tried this before? It can be very helpful in calming the mind and reducing anxiety.

 Yes, I've tried deep breathing exercises before and found them to be somewhat helpful. I'm interested in learning more techniques to add to my toolbox.

 Absolutely, having a variety of techniques can be beneficial in managing anxiety. Another helpful strategy is progressive muscle relaxation. This involves tensing and relaxing different muscle groups in your body, which can help release physical tension and promote relaxation. Would you like to give it a try?

 I haven't tried progressive muscle relaxation before, but it sounds promising. I'm willing to give it a shot, especially if it can help alleviate some of the tension I've been experiencing.

I'm ready to try progressive muscle relaxation right now, as I'm hoping it will help ease the general tension that's been building from my ongoing worries. Let me know how to get started with the exercises.

Great! Let's begin with a simple progressive muscle relaxation exercise. Please find a comfortable seated position, with your back straight and your feet flat on the ground. Take a few deep breaths to settle into the exercise. We'll start by focusing on the muscles in your face. Begin by raising your eyebrows as high as you can, hold for a few seconds, and then release.

 Okay, I've raised my eyebrows and released the tension. I'm feeling a bit more relaxed in my forehead already.

 Wonderful! Now let's move on to your jaw. Clench your teeth together tightly, hold for a moment, and then release. Remember to keep breathing steadily throughout the exercise.

 I've clenched and released my jaw. I can feel some of the tension leaving my face. What's the next muscle group we'll focus on?
I've tensed and released my shoulders as per your guidance, and it's starting to ease some of the built-up tension that's been weighing on me. What's the next muscle group we'll work on?

Great to hear that you're feeling some relief in your shoulders. Let's continue by focusing on your arms and hands. Start by making a tight fist with each hand, hold for a few seconds, and then release.

 I've made fists with both hands and released them. I'm noticing that my arms feel a bit lighter now.

 That's good progress! Next, stretch your arms out in front of you, and then pull them back towards your body, tensing the muscles as you do so. Hold for a moment, and then release.

 I've completed the arm stretching exercise, and it's helping me become more aware of the tension I've been holding onto. What's the next step?

 We'll now move on to your legs. While seated, extend your legs straight out in front of you and point your toes. Hold this position for a few seconds, then release.

 I've extended my legs and pointed my toes as instructed. I can feel the muscles in my legs starting to relax.

 Well done! Now, let's focus on your feet. Curl your toes tightly, hold for a moment, and then release. Remember to continue breathing steadily throughout the exercise.

I've curled my toes tightly and then released them, feeling a slight release of tension in my feet that's helping with the overall anxiety I've been carrying. What's the next muscle group we'll focus on?

We've covered most of the major muscle groups, so let's move on to a full-body stretch to further release any remaining tension. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, and reach your arms up above your head, stretching your entire body. Hold for a few seconds, and then slowly lower your arms back down.

 I've completed the full-body stretch, and it's helped me become more aware of my body as a whole and the anxiety that I've been holding onto.

 It's great to hear that you're becoming more in tune with your body. As we wrap up the progressive muscle relaxation exercise, I want you to take a few deep breaths and perform a mental body scan. Notice any remaining areas of tension and try to consciously release them.

 I've taken some deep breaths and scanned my body, releasing any remaining tension that I could find. Overall, I'm feeling a bit more relaxed and in control of my emotions than when we started.

 That's wonderful progress! Remember, you can practice this technique whenever you feel anxiety starting to build up, as it can help you manage your emotions and regain a sense of control.

 Thank you for guiding me through this exercise.
I appreciate this technique for helping me manage my anxiety more effectively. What's the next step in our sessions?

Now that we've found a technique that helps you manage your anxiety, I suggest we continue practicing it in our future sessions. Consistency is key in building your ability to cope with anxious feelings. We can also explore other relaxation techniques or mindfulness exercises that might further support your emotional well-being.

 As we move forward, it's important to remember that addressing unresolved issues from your past may still be beneficial in reducing anxiety. However, we'll only discuss those experiences when you feel comfortable and ready to do so. Our primary focus will remain on equipping you with the tools you need to manage your emotions effectively.

 How does that sound to you?

That sounds like a good plan I'm on board with continuing the techniques to help manage my ongoing anxiety. I appreciate focusing on building coping tools at my own pace, as it gives me more control over my emotions.

Great! Let's continue practicing these techniques in our future sessions and monitor your progress. It's essential to be patient with yourself and remember that managing anxiety is a process. With consistent practice, you'll likely notice improvements in your ability to cope with anxious feelings.

 As we work together, I'll also provide you with additional resources, such as mindfulness exercises or journaling prompts, which can complement the relaxation techniques we've been practicing. These tools can offer further support in managing your emotions and promoting overall well-being.

 Remember, our goal is to empower you with a variety of strategies that you can use to navigate challenging emotions effectively. Feel free to share your thoughts and experiences during our sessions, as your feedback will help us tailor the techniques to best suit your needs.
I'm looking forward to trying those additional resources to help with my anxiety management. I'd be happy to share more about my experiences so we can adjust the techniques accordingly.

I'm glad to hear that you're open to incorporating additional resources and sharing your experiences. This will help us create a personalized approach to managing your anxiety. As we move forward, remember that progress takes time, and it's essential to be kind to yourself throughout the process.

 For now, continue practicing the relaxation techniques we've discussed, and feel free to explore the additional resources I'll provide. I look forward to hearing about your experiences in our next session. Remember, you can reach out to me if you have any questions or concerns before then.

 Take care, and I'll see you at our next appointment.
Thanks for the resources I'll keep practicing the techniques and give them a try to help manage my anxiety better. See you at the next session.
